comments.author: @headlessguy98
comments.text: School just take away motivation. Sometimes I just really want to research stuff and read up on it, but then I remember school and I just procrastinate, and I never do it. This is why if I have kids they're being home schooled.

comments.author: @crimson1453
comments.text:
School summed up: 
You are forced to wake up before most people, losing sleep at an age where you really need it, you come to class,  forced to learn lessons that nobody asked for with the only reasoning being "it's good for your brain", be completely exhausted from 8 hours at school and have to do another shitload of work at home just for daily hour-lasting "practice". Then there's the tests. If learning shit you don't care about and losing your time wasn't enough, you have to be good at it as well. Or else, you get bad grades and you're getting yelled at by everybody and feel like shit  while your family gets torn apart with rage. But wait, there's more! Not only do you not learn anything that interests you because it isn't a science, but you have to PAY for it as well sometimes. And the worst part is, everybody seems to be okay with this crap, no one tries to speak up and change things. Is this really what school should be in the eyes of the government?...

comments.author: @mykidswillberich
comments.text:
I'm the mom of 3 kids I've never sent to school.  I agree with you.  The issue is that we have been brainwashed that learning takes place within 4 walls called school but learning occurs all the time and everywhere.  It's not an A or a B scribbled on a piece of paper.  My kids have learned tons playing video games and they also live in Europe and have been immersed in several different cultures so they have a great understanding of how others live and don't subscribe to the we do it the best mantra because we are Americans.

School is a place to put kids so their parents can work.  BTW, I just watched a program where a young lady in her 20's had no idea who Napoleon was and asked who he was.  She went to school.  We assume that because we bring up some material that whoever deems important, it will be retained by the student.  Napoleon is an important individual in our history but the bottom line knowing who he is has no practical use in most people's lives.  Just don't go to any cocktail parties in the near future.  HA!

comments.text:
cough *cough *lecture coming. 

I do not disagree with education, if you are an intelligent person it will raise your confidence (in self experience anyway). But I do disagree that most things we learn in school we don't USE in the real world! Life is a wonderful thing, as most people day =P, we are spending it cooped up in classrooms learning /¬£2986:892)@&!9. What's @? Actually, I don't think anyone does that. Swiftly moving on. There is more to life than school! Life is short and we spend the best part of it in school. How are people meant to find out how to enjoy their life? How are we meant to live to the best of our ability? I cannot express this but I think that school is trapping us and preventing us from being free... Humans didn't create life... they have no right to rule over it. 


AAAAND GUYS WAS THAT LONG?! IT WAS LONG FOR ME!!! :D actually it's not that long xD. Ok I'm just ranting now bye xD

comments.author: @jakedesnake97
comments.text:
Yeah... Here's a few thing I learned in school that I'll never be needing:

-Socializing with other people
-Teamwork
-How to analyze a text to understand a message
-Ow to rite proparlly
-How to give a good argumentation
-How to speak in public and be at ease doing so
-Basic first aid
-A second and a third language
-How the Canadian government works (especially useless since we had an election recently)
-Some geopolitics and geography
-Calculus (I'm majoring in economics and I was sure Id' never use it. And I'm totally right)
-Religions of the world (especially useless since NOTHING happens in the news regarding religion)
-How to write a resume
-How my body works (and that's why I'm an anti-vaxxer)
-Sex Ed. (but I planned on staying a virgin my entire life... such a waste of my time :( )
-The Canadian Food Guide
-Woodworking
-Understanding statistics
-Reasearch skill
-Using the Office Suite efficiently



And I'm sure I'm forgetting somethings. After all, I did 9900 hours of my life at school.Ôªø
